topics.body:
no matter how much I like disney's hercules, I can't get over how...wrong everything is...
 Also the fact that it ends on the note of "HERCULES AND MEG LIVED HAPPILY EVER AFTER NOTHING BAD HAPPENED SHUT UP"
topics.author: 500b587e7f123b1f230014a9

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5425bc606368727d842d0000#post_5425bc606368727d842d0000
Well the way I see it is even if it is different, it's still good. So what's the problem? People all the time dismiss The Hunchback of Notre Dame because of the differences from the novel but again, it's a fantastic movie.
And I personally think that Claude Frollo is more interesting in the Disney movie than in the novel.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5425be3b6368722059300000#post_5425be3b6368722059300000
Yeah. Plus pretty much any disney movie based on an existing story is altered a lot. Little mermaid, jungle book, anything based on a grimm story. All pretty fucked up in the source material. 

Maybe it bugs me more because I'm more invested in greek mythology. Which ironically was sparked by watching disney's hercules as a kid. 

Also, I've yet to read the original hunchback of notre dame but I agree that Frollo is such an amazing villain in the disney version. There's parts where it seems like the movie is more about him than quasimodo.

because hera hated him because he was born when zeus decided to screw a mortal

topics.body:
"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5425c347636872583aa50000#post_5425c347636872583aa50000
Hades was actually the coolest guy. Sure he was a bit _disgruntled_ about his post but he didn't blame anybody. He was also loved animals. Dogs in particular. It's his family that were the shitlords. Zeus was an unfaithful douchebag. Hera was a sociopath. Poseidon was a violent asshole. Hestia was pretty cool. Demeter too.

"Greek myths have always been a fascinating subject to me. Tales of treacherous journeys and epic voyages across the sea! Mythological beasts of old and the very fabric of nature itself. They tell of humans, creating larger than life heroes and gods in their own flawed image. No one is safe from his or her own hubris...

*SO TO MAKE AN EXAMPLE OF MY POINT I'MMA PLAY A HERCULES GAME ON COMMODORE 64*"
